body:
It also happens with Electron **1.6.7**
It doesnt happen when using **1.6.2**

The stack for this crash is:


```

electron.exe!content::NavigatorImpl::NavigateToEntry(class content::FrameTreeNode *,class content::FrameNavigationEntry const &,class content::NavigationEntryImpl const &,enum content::ReloadType,bool,bool,bool,class scoped_refptr<class content::ResourceRequestBodyImpl> const &)	Unknown

electron.exe!atom::api::WebContents::LoadURL(const GURL & url, const mate::Dictionary & options) Line 1014	C++
```

@deepak1556 anything jump out to you on this one?
Hope this will be helpful https://forum.freeter.io/topic/168/unexpected-crashes Started crashing after 1.6.2 (1.6.5 or 1.6.6).

issue.title: Webview redirect fails to load

repository.name: electron
repository.description: :electron: Build cross-platform desktop apps with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS

issue.body:
* Electron version: 
1.7.2 - OK
1.6.11  - has bug
1.6.3 - has bug
1.6.2 - does not appear to have bug, but has other instabilities
1.5.1 - OK
1.3.x and before - OK
* Operating system: Windows 8

### Expected behavior

Page should redirect ok as it used to..

### Actual behavior

At some point during redirect, the page fails to load. This shows the did-load-fail event occuring after a did-navigate.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/309321/26677670/42c48404-46cd-11e7-81e6-0990ddf3b369.png)

The bug occurs 1 time in 2, but on a different redirect each time.

As well as getting load fail, the webview does not render anything and if devtools is attached to the window, it shows a disconnected message.

According the fiddler the page that the webview emits a load fail on is fetched successfully - no network problems with the page.

I've investigated if it could be:
#8505 but changing the webview to always be visible doesn't help
#6139 but disabling hardware acceleration does not help

I've looked up the error code 0 and error status "OK" and can't find any info about what might cause it.

Any help debugging or diagnosing would be appreciated.

body: I had a similiar bug and it seems fixed in 1.7.2

Still happening using 1.7.3

Doesn't happen on Linux, only on Windows
Not sure if my issue is the same issue, but I'm getting a similar stacktrace. I'm only getting the error when I change src or loadURL the 2nd time (after it has loaded some page already).
I got the same. The webview was hidden via css.

issue.title: [Bug] Using 'reload current service' on a crashed service tab is quitting ttth

repository.name: ttth
repository.description: ttth (talk to the hand) is an electron based desktop app for online services like WhatsApp, Threema, Telegram, Twitter, Google and several others.

issue.body:
**Describe the bug**
Trying to reload the current service is crahsing ttth if the service itself crashed before


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Crash a service
2. Make the crashed service the active tab
3. Press F10 to reload the current service
4. ttth is quitting

**Expected behavior**
Unsure so far, but it shouldn't crash the entire app


**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: windows 8.1
 - ttth version: 1.8.x

via @sceptiq
